_comment: This data is an early work-in-progress and contains errors. Produced by @michaelh at Discuss and Discover SuttaCentral forum - please get in touch! Finished code forthcoming.

Six types of people found in the world [: A sweet-natured person who has not listened, learned, or comprehended theoretically, and found even temporary freedom
A sweet-natured person who has listened, learned, and comprehended theoretically, and found temporary freedom
An angry and conceited person who has not listened, learned, or comprehended theoretically, and found even temporary freedom
An angry and conceited person who has listened, learned, and comprehended theoretically, and found temporary freedom
A person who has the impulse to speak inappropriately and has not listened, learned, or comprehended theoretically, and found even temporary freedom
A person who has the impulse to speak inappropriately but has listened, learned, and comprehended theoretically, and found temporary freedom
Judgmental people compare them [an6.44:1: This will be for their lasting harm and suffering.
Laywoman Migasālā's family members (a re: Purāṇa, who was celibate and set apart, avoiding the common practice of sex
Isidatta, who lived content with his wife
The lack of each individual [an6.44:18.3: If Isidatta had achieved Purāṇa’s level of ethical conduct, Purāṇa could not have even known Isidatta’s destination.
If Purāṇa had achieved Isidatta’s level of wisdom, Isidatta could not have even known Purāṇa’s destination.
